title: Are grades decided by early game?
body:
^title

Iv'e noticed on games that i snowball really early and get first blood at level 2 or 3 i will get an S grade regardless of how the rest of the match goes, if it goes average i'll still get an S as long as i go positive.

However on games that i do average for the first half and then start making fantastic plays later i won't receive an S grade no matter how much i do because of the first half, triple kills, quads, objective+kills, it just doesn't matter man.

For example this match i had i went 19/8/13 got 22k gold, had 291 cs and got an A+, i did meh at the beginning since i was against Kata and her jungle was very veeeeery close all match, so i played passively till i got a Maw to counter Kata's initial poop on you combo. From there on i was able to snowball, get fed, hit level 18 before anyone else and 1vs3 people. But no S grade v.v

What gives man how does this crap work now a days? halp Rito v.v

replies.body:
Grades are determined off kills, deaths, assists, cs, & team performance. Based on how well people in your elo play that champion, your scores in those categories are compared the the average and you receive a grade. For example if you get so many kills but you still have a few deaths, it might still be possible to get an S, but at least on most of my champions, to get an S+ (Gold 4) you need to have 10+ kills, 3- deaths, and really good cs also.

Based on your example, 8 deaths is alot, and is hard to get a good grade with that. Also based off the score of the game im going to guess it went at least 40-50 minutes, and your cs isnt that good for that (only 6 per min or 1/2 the minions that spawn in a lane). So thats probably why. Also maybe you had a teamate that carried you?
It is percentile based on total performance of that champion.
depends on how well your teamates did along with the enemies, and at what times did you end up achieving 8 deaths.
